title: Thugs who battered frail man with metal bar at bus stop in broad daylight jailed

Horrifying footage shows two cowardly thugs beating a frail man with a metal bar after they demand cash from him at a bus stop.

Tayub Zaman and Kyle Causer, both 25, were jailed this week for carrying out the brutal attack on the victim, who uses a walking stick, in the Birmingham area of Bordesley Green.

The helpless man, who is in his 50s, tried to move away as the pair demanded cash and searched his pockets as he fell to the ground, BirminghamLive reports.

The CCTV clip shows them kicking and hitting him with the metal bar causing a gash on his head.

(Image: BPM Media)

The callous pair then dragged the man along the floor, with the violence only coming to an end when a passer-by ran to help.

Both fled empty-handed leaving their bruised and battered victim behind.

Zaman, from Bordesley Green, pleaded guilty to assault with intent and possession of an offensive weapon and was jailed for four years and six months.

He also admitted charges of driving without a licence and driving without insurance.

(Image: BPM Media)

Causer, who is currently in Stoke Heath prison, admitted intent to rob and having an offensive weapon and was sentenced to four years and four months.

Police released the footage in an appeal to find them a month after the attack place in July this year.

Their previous appeal read: “Police want to trace this pair after a man with a walking stick was kicked and hit with a metal bar during an attempted robbery in Bordesley Green Birmingham.

“The victim was standing at a bus stop along Bordesley Green when he was approached by two men who demanded cash.

“They tried to search the pockets of the man, aged in his 50s, who fell to the floor.

“He was then attacked and struck with the bar which caused a cut to his head.

“The assault only stopped when a member of the public intervened and the attackers fled empty handed.”
description: Tayub Zaman and Kyle Causer, both 25, carried out the brutal attack on the victim, who uses a walking stick, in the Birmingham area of Bordesley Green
